p: The TPC of C. intybus extracts was spectrophotometrically determined by Folin-Ciocâlteu method with some modifications [ 80]. Briefly, 2 mL of both methanol and ethanol extracts were diluted in a 25 mL calibrated flask with the same solvent. 2 mL of each solution were mixed with 1 mL Folin-Ciocâlteu reagent, 10 mL of distilled water and diluted to 25 mL with a solution of sodium carbonate (290 g/L). The samples were stored in darkness for 30 min., and then the absorbance was measured at 760 nm using a Cary 60 ultraviolet–visible (UV–Vis) spectrophotometer from Agilent Technologies (R 2 = 0.999). TPC was expressed as gallic acid equivalents (GAE)/g dry plant material [ 81]. All the TPC determinations were realized in triplicate.
